key_channel_insights.line_content: Parity holds at 97.4%, yet ‘website offer not found’ doubled to 0.9%, mainly on close-in long-haul searches.
Metasearch delivered 99.92% parity with only 0.08% gaps, concentrated in >90-day searches.
Parity is solid at 98.3%, but fare premiums grew 36% WoW, led by long-haul and non-US origins.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 97.4% of OTA fares matched the website last week, sustaining best-in-class parity despite a minor 0.4-pt dip.
‘Website offer not found’ doubled WoW to 0.9% of itineraries, driven by a +0.63-pt surge in close-in searches.
Long-haul shows 2.4% of fares priced higher on OTAs with a 0.34% average markup—three times the short-haul rate.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 0.9% of OD pairs absent on OTAs, up 0.43 pts WoW and 0.15 pts MoM.
Parity steady at 97.4% (-0.4 pts WoW), confirming channel stability.
1.3% of fares priced above site (avg +0.23%), down 0.17 pts WoW.
0.4% of itineraries cheaper on OTAs (avg –0.15%); commercially negligible.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Parity strongest at 97.8%; OTA premiums limited to 1.1% (+0.19% diff).
Parity dips to 95.0%; OTA premiums double to 2.4% (+0.34% diff).

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Parity improved to 94.1%, yet premiums 3.2% (+0.45%)—audit priority.

mse_highlights.line_content: 99.92% of fares matched DL.com, underscoring exceptional integrity.
Absent offers rose to 0.08%, driven by 0.24% gaps in >90-day window.
Only 0.01% of itineraries priced higher; 25% average premium points to isolated caching errors.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 0.08% of OD pairs absent, up 0.05 pt WoW yet 0.03 pt better MoM.
Parity at 99.92% with an immaterial 0.06-pt dip WoW.
Zero instances of MSE undercutting the website for three weeks.
0.01% higher fares, concentrated in long-haul, avg +25%.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 99.89% parity; 0.05% mark-ups and half of missing offers.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Achieved 100% parity with zero pricing issues.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Parity slips to 99.76%; gaps spike to 0.24%—main WoW driver.

gds_highlights.line_content: GDS matched web fares on 98.3% of itineraries, holding >98% parity MoM.
GDS-higher cases grew 36% WoW to 1.3%; avg premium widened to +0.23%.
Long-haul (2.4% higher) and non-US origins (3.2% higher) show outsized premiums.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 0.1% of fares not found, flat WoW and down 48% MoM.
Parity steady at 98.3% vs. 98.7% prior week.
Channel-lower rare at 0.35%, avg –0.16%, up 7% WoW.
Premium share 1.25%, up 36% WoW; avg +0.23% markup.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Parity 96.2%; premiums 3.2% (+0.46%), though frequency eased 3% WoW.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Premiums lower at 0.8% but markup higher (+0.42%); parity 99.0%.
